Summary Having a broad background gives me a unique perspective which helps me understand customers' needs and match solutions to their requirements. This experience has helped me in recently leading VMware's ITBM inside sales group in goal achievement and, more recently, in breaking into new international territories at White Source. 
 
My experience in large companies (IBM, VMware), startups (Digital Fuel, White Source) and my own company (AnyOpen) ranges: 
•	from being a product expert in the IBM mainframe environment (CICS); consulting and educating IBM enterprise customers 
•	thru technical pre-sales presenting IBM software products for multiple environments at various venues from one on one to audiences of hundreds 
•	to international software sales selling software solutions to sectors from hi-tech to enterprise 
 
Currently, I am leading sales at White Source Software helping customers get all the benefits of open source without the pitfalls of license compliance and security risks. Currently, I am leading sales at White Source Software helping customers get all the benefits of open source without the pitfalls of license compliance and security risks. Experience Sales Director White Source July 2013  – Present (2 years 2 months) Developers integrate Open Source Software components into their projects in order to save time and money during the development process. However, all OSS components are licensed under one of the various OSS licenses. Many have known security vulnerabilities. 
 
White Source provides a simple yet powerful solution for managing open source assets to help ensure license compliance and reduce security risks. This easy to use SaaS solution automatically:  
- detects Open Source as it is introduced into the development process 
- identifies it’s license and the licenses of all its dependencies 
- highlights known security vulnerabilities and notifies about new ones 
- tracks versions in order to provide notifications when new versions are available that fix security vulnerabilities and/or major bugs. 
 
We enable our customers to free their developers from this chore in order to let them do what they do best: develop great software. Software Sales VMware June 2009  –  March 2013  (3 years 10 months) Generating new business via Inside Sales / Business Development to large enterprises, mainly in Europe. 
 
VMware's ITBM (IT Business Management Suite) provides unprecedented visibility into, and control of, costs and risks to help you run IT like a business, leveraging both private and public cloud services. Covering IT Finance Management, Vendor Governance and Service Level Management, ITBM helps you ensure that your IT investment is aligned with your business goals. 
 
(Formerly Digital Fuel, VMware acquired Digital Fuel in July 2011) Co-CEO AnyOpen Ltd. August 2006  –  December 2010  (4 years 5 months) Israel Developed Israeli market for Open Source Software license management 
 
Re-seller of Black Duck Software

Summary Career Objective:  
To become expert in Software Solution Design, Data Management, Analytics. 
 
 
Professional Experience & Profile Summary: 
 
Currently working as IBM Certified IT Specialist (Expert) with total (IT and non-IT included) 15+ years of client facing experience. 
 
Have worked with prominent clients from various industries such as – banking, insurance, NBFC, police, defence, media & entertainment, fertilizers, government – state & central, telecom, BPO, chemicals, logistics, stock exchange, education, etc. 
 
Currently working as Software Solution Architect for IBM software technologies.  
 
Previously worked with clients from industries such as - banking, insurance, NBFC, telecomm, M&E, Police, etc – as technical pre-sales consultant for Sales Performance Management, Financial Performance Management, Social Media Analytics. 
 
Have successfully guided, mentored Channel Partners (tier-2) of IBM Business Analytics in the area of - value proposition, sales plays of Cognos BI and Predictive Analytics (IBM SPSS) - as Technical Pre-Sales (Client Technical Professional). 
 
Have more than 6 years of experience in designing, architecting data management layer for comprehensive IT solutions and technical pre-sales for IBM Data Management offerings. 
 
Developed and successfully used technical assets in the form of demos, papers - for technical pre-sales of IBM Data Management, Sales Performance Management.

Additionally; Proven Experience in …

Experience Innovation Centre Marketing and Events Coordinator IBM January 2013  – Present (2 years 8 months) The Innovation Centre (IIC) holds an average of 5 events per quarter ranging from 1 to 5 days with between 20 and 40 attendees. I manage the end-to-end process of coordinating these events which involves all aspects of planning, budgeting, execution and marketing. Whilst mindful of our strategic priorities I seek experts in the appropriate field and start researching potential event ideas. I take the events through to fruition and work hard to generate an audience. Planning and organisation is an integral part of this role, my diligence with this has improved the management of the information, and allows the team to work collaboratively to ensure all components are complete and the information is easily accessible. Managing a budget is a new experience for me, again effective planning has assisted me with this by ensuring I have sufficient funds to cover costs, whilst maintaining a record of expenditure to comply with audit regulations. 
I took complete ownership of our exhibitor stand at a recent event and created a “Pop-Up” Innovation Centre as well as arranging round table sessions. Feedback highlighted the success of both components, my conscientiousness and attention to detail resulted in smooth running on the day and gave a positive experience for the partners. Along with the logistics of the stand I also designed and produced the marketing collateral used on the day and to advertise the event. 
I am the team leader for two interns who manage the day-to-day operations of the IIC which involves an average of 25 business partner and client meetings per week. I ensure they have the opportunities to work in the areas of interest to them whilst still ensuring the objectives of the team are met. I have taken ownership of the section and as such I have been able to flourish professionally. Technical Pre-Sales IBM October 2011  –  December 2012  (1 year 3 months) I worked in Technical Pre-Sales for IBM Collaboration Systems which has given me experience in a dynamic and demanding sales role. To utilise my previous experience with data capture and management, and collaborative working I took an interest in IBM Connections and IBM Forms Experience Builder (FEB). I attended a number of client meetings giving me the opportunity to explore their requirements and look to how IBM can add value. I worked on the different stages of the technical sales process and gained experience of replying to RFPs, working through PoTs and developing PoCs. I organised an FEB training day for IBM business partners; as the software was new I created my own training materials and presented and demonstrated the software capabilities at the event. This role proved to be a good experience and gave me an awareness of IBM sales. Collaborative Working Capability Exploitation UK Ministry of Defence January 2007  –  October 2011  (4 years 10 months) I started here by developing and maintaining web applications. 
I was then promoted into the role of Collaborative Working Capability Exploitation which allowed me to expand on the skills and knowledge I'd already begun to develop. Project managing the pilot roll out of the collaborative working tool provided me with an exciting and challenging opportunity. The project determined the go/no-go decision for rolling out the software throughout the wider MoD so as well as being high pressure it was also high profile, with a tight deadline to meet. 
Following the successful pilot a project to roll out the software to other units was established. At this point myself and my team were responsible for enabling the end users to effectively exploit the new tool. As well as introducing the technological change the greatest challenge was the cultural change. It was important to find the unique selling point for each individual unit to enable them to see the value in the new tool and to embrace the change. I focused on process improvement to set best practices and standardised routine tasks with the overall aim to improve efficiency. I had a particular interest in the storage and consequent use of data, making data capture methods simple and providing reporting methods suitable to meet the requirements of the organisation. I developed and maintained a library of best practice examples, will full instructions on how to implement the solutions. The project determined the go/no-go decision for rolling out the software throughout the wider MoD so as well as being high pressure it was also high profile, with a tight deadline to meet. 
Following the successful pilot a project to roll out the software to other units was established. At this point myself and my team were responsible for enabling the end users to effectively exploit the new tool. As well as introducing the technological change the greatest challenge was the cultural change. It was important to find the unique selling point for each individual unit to enable them to see the value in the new tool and to embrace the change. I focused on process improvement to set best practices and standardised routine tasks with the overall aim to improve efficiency. I had a particular interest in the storage and consequent use of data, making data capture methods simple and providing reporting methods suitable to meet the requirements of the organisation. I developed and maintained a library of best practice examples, will full instructions on how to implement the solutions. Summary During his studies Jonas was already fascinated by networks, both wired and wireless, and the tremendous range of applications they can support. When he jumped into his professional life, he continued to follow his passion by taking the role of IT specialist networking and unified communications within IBM 
 
After gaining some experience as IT specialist on several projects at customer site, he continued as technical pre-sales for IBM Cloud and Smarter Infrastructure software. His main focus in this role is designing software solutions for (mobile) endpoint management. In this way he is broadening his skills and making the link with the business. 
 
He is a good planner and a creative team player, qualities that were revealed when he was group leader of the local youth movement. Furthermore he is enthusiastic to help clients and business partners to choose the right technology solution to solve their business problems. 
 
Specialties:  
Creative solution design. Project planning. Structured approach. Eagerness to learn. Effective communication and efficient teamwork. 
 
Design and pre-sales of monitoring and (mobile) endpoint management solutions based on IBM Cloud and Smarter Infrastructure (formerly Tivoli) software. 
Design, implementation and support of networking and unified communications solutions based on Cisco Collaboration platforms. Summary I am Technical Trainer at Amazon Web Services. I am teaching partners and end users how to use AWS services and how to architect software solutions to take advantage of AWS cloud infrastructure. 
 
Classes are run on a regular schedule in our european headquarters in Luxembourg or on demand anywhere in EMEA. 
 
I am passionate about IT Technology at large, with special interest in development platforms, mobile and cloud computing and the Java eco-system. I am the co-founder of the Luxembourg Java User Group. 
 
Before joining Amazon, I was Technical pre-sales for IBM, Oracle and Sun Microsystems. I was mapping customers paint points to Middleware solutions (SOA, ESB, BPM, ...) 
 
I am a regular speaker at local and international events (AWSome Days, AWS Summits, Devoxx 2012, Oracle Marketing Events, JavaOne 2008-2009-2010, Tech Days @ Sun, several Java User Groups across Europe, Linux Tags etc ...) 
 
I define myself as a Geek 2.0, i.e. a geek with social and communication skills ... usually an empty set. 
 
Specialties: 
AWS, Cloud & Enterprise Architecture, Software Architecture, Development Workflows, Mobile Applications Development & Management

Summary My career in Enterprise Content Management has spanned the best part of 13 years. I started my career in South Africa, as a FileNet Technical Consultant for a leading business partner before moving to a customer to do a large implementation. In 2005 I was offered an opportunity to work for FileNet and I moved to the United Kingdom to continue my career.  
 
During the early years of my career, I was involved directly with customers through the business partner where I was responsible for the design, implementation and support of the ECM technologies (FileNet Panagon) that preceded the current market equivalents (IBM FileNet P8).  
Moving away from the business partner, I joined a large public sector company to implement the IBM FileNet P8 suite with Enterprise Records to 2000 users to replace their paper based document and records management system and it was at this time I became partly responsible for a well know online ECM user community called “ECM Place”. 
 
Moving to the United Kingdom and joining FileNet in 2005 and then IBM in 2007, I continued my career as a Technical Consultant for IBM ECM Services. Being a technical consultant I was directly involved in implementations in a number of large banking, insurance and companies in other industries until 2008 and then moved into the Accelerated Value Program for ECM to take on the role as an Accelerated Value Leader and Technical Specialist. 
 
In 2010 I moved into my current role as a Client Solution Professional, better known as Technical Pre-Sales for IBM ECM. This role has required me to leverage all of my communication, leadership and technical skills on a daily basis, but has also allowed me to gain a deeper understanding of the extended IBM ECM & non-ECM IBM Software Portfolio, Business Partner and competitive offerings. Specialties:IBM Enterprise Content Management (FileNet P8, Datacap, Content Analytics, Social Collaboration, Content Collection and Archiving) 
IBM WebSphere Application Server 
Microsoft Platform Support (Windows, SQL) 
UNIX/Linux Support (Sun, AIX, HP, Redhat) 
Platform Architecture and Design 
Solution Architecture and Design
